pli-tv-bi-vb-pc33:0.2: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc33:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc33:0.5: 33. The training rule on making ill at ease
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc33:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc33:1.2: At that time the nun Thullanandā was a learned reciter, and she was confident and skilled at giving teachings.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc33:1.3: Bhaddā Kāpilānī, too, was a learned reciter who was confident and skilled at giving teachings, and she was respected for her excellence.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc33:1.5: Because of this, people visited Bhaddā Kāpilānī first and then Thullanandā.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc33:1.7: “These ones always ask for things and tell people what to do, and yet they are supposedly contented and have few desires, supposedly secluded and not socializing.” And in front of Bhaddā Kāpilānī she walked back and forth, stood, sat down, and lay down, and she recited, got others to recite, and practiced recitation.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc33:1.8: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc33:1.9: “How could Venerable Thullanandā intentionally make Bhaddā Kāpilānī ill at ease?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc33:1.10: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Thullanandā did this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc33:1.13: “… How can the nun Thullanandā intentionally make Bhaddā Kāpilānī ill at ease?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc33:1.14: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc33:1.15: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule thus:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc33:1.16: ‘If a nun intentionally makes a nun ill at ease, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc33:2.1.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination by both complete Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc33:2.1.8: knowing, perceiving, having intended, having decided, she transgresses.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc33:2.1.10: if, without asking permission, but thinking, “In this way she will be ill at ease,” she walks back and forth in front of her, or she stands, sits down, or lies down in front of her, or she recites, gets others to recite, or practices recitation in front of her, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc33:2.2.1: If the other person is fully ordained, and she perceives her as such, and she intentionally makes her ill at ease, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc33:2.2.2: If the other person is fully ordained, but she is unsure if she is, and she intentionally makes her ill at ease, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc33:2.2.3: If the other person is fully ordained, but she does not perceive her as such, and she intentionally makes her ill at ease, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc33:2.2.4: If the other person is not fully ordained, and she intentionally makes her ill at ease, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc33:2.2.5: If the other person is not fully ordained, but she perceives her as fully ordained, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc33:2.2.6: If the other person is not fully ordained, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc33:2.2.7: If the other person is not fully ordained, and she does not perceive her as fully ordained, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc33:2.3.2: if, after asking permission and not desiring to make her ill at ease, she walks back and forth in front of her, or she stands, sits down, or lies down in front of her, or she recites, gets others to recite, or practices recitation in front of her;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc33:2.3.4: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc33:2.3.5: The third training rule is finished.
